comments.author: shaunld@gmail.com
comments.text:
User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; rv:2.0b13pre) Gecko/20110226 Firefox/4.0b13pre
Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; rv:2.0b13pre) Gecko/20110226 Firefox/4.0b13pre

Happens on trunk nightly (4.0b13pre), Windows 7 SP1, Intel 945GM graphics, Sherry v1.2 drivers from http://angelictears9xxssf.wordpress.com/ .

Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Install Grafx Bot addon.
2. Restart Firefox and click on System Info when Grafx Bot tab is automatically created after the restart.
3. Open about:support and scroll to the bottom section.
4. Compare the "Adapter RAM" values.
Actual Results:  
about:support "Adapter RAM" shows unknown.
Grafx Bot "System Info" page shows 256 MB.

Expected Results:  
about:support "Adapter RAM" shows the correct shared memory value, which is 256 MB in this case.
comments.creator: shaunld@gmail.com

comments.author: andrei.domuta@softvision.ro
comments.text:
Could not reproduce the issue on the latest Firefox Aurora:
 Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; rv:6.0a2) Gecko/20110602 Firefox/6.0a2

> Happens on trunk nightly (4.0b13pre), Windows 7 SP1, Intel 945GM graphics,
> Sherry v1.2 drivers from http://angelictears9xxssf.wordpress.com/ .

Reporter, can you still see the issue on the latest Firefox build?
Link: http://www.mozilla.com/en-US/firefox/new/

comments.author: shaunld@gmail.com
comments.text: AndreiD, is your PC equipped with an Intel 945GM video chipset? The issue persists with the latest Nightly.
